name: USS Defiant
description: Formerly the USS São Paulo. Assigned to space station Deep Space Nine. Participates in the Battle of Cardassia.

name: SS Vico
description: Research vessel that was in service with Starfleet in the mid-24th century. This ship was on loan to a civilian agency, and was given a civilian registry. Vico operated out of Starbase 514. In 2368, the Vico explored an astronomical formation known as a black cluster. Found derelict by Enterprise-D.

name: USS Raven
description: Science and exploration vessel used by the Hansens for exploration of the Delta Quadrant where Seven of Nine was assimilated by the Borg.

name: USS YorktownUSS Enterprise (from 2286)
description: Disabled by whale probe, then possibly salvaged and renamed Enterprise; although no onscreen evidence supports this. Command given to James T. Kirk following his demotion to Captain. Primary setting for Star Trek V: The Final Frontier and Star Trek VI: The Undiscovered Country, later decommissioned.

name: USS Houston
description: The Houston, commanded by Admiral D'Vak, lead the federation in an assault against the Borg Queen's Octahedron in the space around the Unicomplex.

name: USS Kelvin
description: In the timeline at the start of the movie Star Trek, the Kelvin was in service with Starfleet in the early 23rd century. In 2233, the Kelvin was under the command of Captain Richard Robau; his first officer was Lieutenant Commander George Kirk. Kirk's wife, Winona, was also aboard the ship at that time while she was pregnant with their son, James T. Kirk. The Kelvin was destroyed by the Romulan mining ship Narada, which arrived from the distant future through an artificial black hole. Named for director J. J. Abrams' grandfather. Its registry number, NCC-0514, comes from Abrams's birthdate of May 14.

name: USS Endeavour
description: Originally the last active NX class starship in the Earth Starfleet. Transferred to Federation Starfleet service and rebuilt into the first Columbia class starship.

name: USS T'Plana-Hath
description: Destroyed at the Battle at the Binary Stars.

name: USS Constellation
description: Commanded by Commodore Matthew Decker. All of crew was killed by the Doomsday Machine except for Commodore Decker. Used as a bomb to destroy the planet-killer.

name: USS Crossfield
description: Presumable namesake ship for the class.

name: USS Glenn
description: Sister ship to the Discovery. Scuttled following a failed propulsion experiment.

name: USS Discovery
description: Titular ship in 2017 television series Star Trek: Discovery. Initially commanded by Captain Gabriel Lorca, and later by Captain Christopher Pike, the Discovery is a science vessel commissioned to investigate potential forms of faster-than-light propulsion such as the spore drive.

name: USS Hermes
description: Part of the tachyon blockade during the Klingon Civil War.

name: USS Earhart
description: Fought at the Battle at the Binary Stars.

name: USS Horatio
description: Commanded by Captain Walker Keel. Destroyed by agents of an alien conspiracy to take over Starfleet.

name: USS Ajax
description: Cortin Zweller's first assignment. Received experimental warp drive technology. Part of the tachyon blockade during the Klingon Civil War.

name: USS Agamemnon
description: Part of the tachyon blockade during the Klingon Civil War. Part of "Task Force 3" sent to face an anticipated Borg attack.

name: USS Gage
description: Destroyed at the Battle of Wolf 359.

name: USS Clement
description: Scheduled to rendezvous with the Enterprise-D.

name: USS Kerala
description: Destroyed at the Battle at the Binary Stars.

name: USS Ride
description: Fought at the Battle at the Binary Stars.

name: USS Gagarin
description: Ambushed and destroyed by the Klingons.

name: USS Republic
description: Although many reference sources included Republic as a Constitution-class heavy cruiser, its status in canon is, to date, uncertain. Kirk himself stated in the episode "Court Martial" the ship's nomenclature as "United Starship Republic, number 1371".

name: USS Okinawa
description: Ship commanded by Admiral James Leyton and on which Benjamin Sisko served as first officer.

name: USS Shran
description: Destroyed at the Battle at the Binary Stars.

name: USS Buran
description: The ship was ambushed by Klingons about a month after the beginning of the 2256 Federation-Klingon war and apparently destroyed. Its captain at the time was Gabriel Lorca.At some point Lorca was replaced by his mirror-universe counterpart, who impersonated him and reported that ship was boarded, then set to self destruct by him so that its crew doesn't fall into Klingon hands and face degradation, torture and slow public death.

name: USS Berlin
description: Patrolled the Romulan Neutral Zone.

name: USS Yeager
description: Destroyed at the Battle at the Binary Stars.

name: USS Fearless
description: Assigned to planetary mapping in the Beta Mahoga system. Received new warp technology. Briefly seen in The Next Generation episode "Where No One Has Gone Before"

name: USS Carolina
description: Freighter.

name: USS Sioux
description: Fought at the Battle at the Binary Stars.

name: USS Valiant
description: For his influential "The Case of Jonathan Doe Starship" article, published in the April 1973 issue 27 of the T-Negative fanzine, future Star Trek model maker Greg Jein accepted the producer's intent and endowed Valiant with the appropriately lower conjectural registry number NCC-1623. But unlike many of his other conjectural Constitution-class registry numbers, the 2006 remastered version of the series afforded no opportunity to bring this ship to canon. The reference book Star Fleet Technical Manual also listed a Constitution-class starship with the name Valiant but assigned with the registry NCC-1709. The 1973 Franz Joseph Blueprints list this ship as NCC-1709 also.

name: USS Intrepid
description: All-Vulcan crew destroyed by a massive, spacegoing single-celled life form. The 1973 Franz Joseph Blueprints list this ship as NCC-1708.

name: USS Farragut
description: Ship on which James Kirk served as a phaser station operator. Attacked by the dikironium cloud creature, which killed half the crew. The ship never appeared on screen and was never given a class or registry number; both come from The Star Trek Encyclopedia. The 1973 Franz Joseph Blueprints list this ship as NCC-1702.

name: USS Europa
description: Commanded by Admiral Brett Anderson. Destroyed by a cloaked Klingon ship during the Battle at the Binary Stars.

name: USS Korolev
description: Presumable namesake ship for the class.

name: USS Potemkin
description: Participates in Richard Daystrom's M5 computer test. See USS Kongo for its ultimate fate. The 1973 Franz Joseph Blueprints list this ship as NCC-1711.

name: USS Clarke
description: Destroyed at the Battle at the Binary Stars.

name: USS Excalibur
description: Severely damaged and crew killed during Richard Daystrom's M5 computer test. In TOS episode "The Ultimate Computer", the death of its entire crew is established, however, the status of the Excalibur itself is unclear. It is not determined whether the ship was destroyed or severely damaged. The Star Trek Chronology (2nd ed., p. 88) stated that the ship was destroyed. The fourth edition of the Star Trek Encyclopedia offered two possibilities of the conditions of the Excalibur – the ship was severely damaged in (vol. 1, p. 254) or accidentally destroyed in (vol. 2, p. 329). Even though the episode itself provided no firm confirmation either way. The 1973 Franz Joseph Blueprints list this ship as NCC-1705.

name: USS Exeter
description: All crew lost (killed by alien disease) except for Captain Ronald Tracey, who was on the planet's surface when the disease struck his crew. At the end of the series Captain James T. Kirk stated that the Exeter was an abandoned ship, being infected with the virus of Omega IV. Best estimates were that the Exeter was destroyed to keep the infection from spreading throughout the galaxy. See USS Kongo for its ultimate fate. The 1973 Franz Joseph Blueprints list this ship as NCC-1706.

name: USS Edison
description: Destroyed at the Battle at the Binary Stars.

name: USS Dana
description: Fought at the Battle at the Binary Stars.

name: USS Helin
description: Patrolled the Romulan Neutral Zone.

name: USS Constitution
description: Lead ship of the class (previously NX-1700).

name: USS Enterprise
description: Commanded by Robert April (2245–2250), Christopher Pike (2250–2265), James T. Kirk (2265–2270, 2273–2280, 2285), Willard Decker (2270–2273, ship's commander during refit up to V'Ger incident), and Spock (2280–2285, at which time Enterprise was assigned to Starfleet Academy as a training ship). Vessel's self-destruction carried out while in orbit of the Genesis planet to prevent ship from falling into Klingon hands.

name: USS Enterprise
description: Ship aboard which James T. Kirk is lost and presumed dead. First commanded by Captain Jon Harriman.

name: USS Enterprise
description: Commanded by Captain Rachel Garrett presumed to be Killed In Action when the ship was destroyed defending the Klingon outpost at Narendra III from Romulan attack. Helmsman Richard Castillo assumed command of the Enterprise-C in 2366 and returned to the year 2344 where the ship was destroyed defending the Klingon outpost.

name: USS Enterprise
description: Primary setting for Star Trek: The Next Generation. Captained by Jean-Luc Picard. Launched in 2363. Destroyed in 2371. Engineering section destroyed by warp core breach at Veridian III. Saucer section crash landed on Veridian III and rendered unsalvageable.

name: USS Enterprise
description: Primary setting for Star Trek: First Contact, Star Trek: Insurrection, Star Trek Nemesis and also made an appearance on Bridge Commander. Captained by Jean-Luc Picard.

name: USS Enterprise
description: Commanded by Captain Va'kel Shon. Participated in the second battle for Deep Space Nine as well as the final battle against the Iconians in Star Trek: Online.

name: USS Pegasus
description: Patrolled the Klingon Neutral Zone.

name: USS Hood
description: Participates in Richard Daystrom's M5 computer test. Destroyed by sabotage in Star Trek Continues episode 7, "Embracing the Winds". In episodes 10–11 "To Boldly Go", we find out this was done by espers. The 1973 Franz Joseph Blueprints list this ship as NCC-1707.

name: USS Ranger (Simulation ship)
description: Another simulated Enterprise class ship used by Starfleet Academy trainees in Star Trek: Starfleet Academy.

name: USS Lexington
description: Participates in Richard Daystrom's M5 computer test. Commanded by Commodore Robert Wesley. The 1973 Franz Joseph Blueprints list this ship as NCC-1703.

name: USS Kongo
description: In Star Trek Continues episodes 10–11 "To Boldly Go", the Kongo is hijacked by espers and taken to the galactic barrier. They then head for Earth with murderous intent. With the help of Romulan commander Charvanek and her Hawk's Talon, the Enterprise foils them, but not before they trick the Exeter and Potemkin into destroying each other. In their last act of defiance, the espers destroy the Kongo.

name: USS Kongo
description: The war with Starfleet took a heavy toll,The decision to bring out some of its old ship names from mothball, the USS Kongo was Commissioned on stardate:50938.10 in the year 2373 under the command of Captain Donavon until the near future. The Alphabet letter (A) was put on to the NCC-1710 hull number to honor the Kongo from the year 2293. The USS Kongo NCC-1710-A was the 2nd ship to bear the name of the Kongo. The Plaque reads as follows ("Never give up, Never Surrender")

name: USS Yorktown
description: Disabled by alien probe. The 1973 Franz Joseph Blueprints list this ship as NCC-1704.

name: USS Essex
description: Damaged and crashed on Mab-Bu VI.

name: USS Sentinel
description: Appears in Star Trek: Invasion. Also mentioned in the great transaction for graviton stabilizers.

name: USS Horizon
description: A model of this ship was on display in the school aboard Deep Space 9 in early 2369. (DS9: "The Nagus").

name: USS Defiant
description: The ship is lost in an interdimensional rift in "The Tholian Web". Later, it is revealed she was taken by Mirror Universe Tholians, captured by the crew of the ISS Enterprise (NX-01), and then used in the service of the Terran Empire in "In a Mirror, Darkly". In Star Trek Continues (episode 8, "Still Treads the Shadow"), Defiant is duplicated during its passage through the interdimensional rift into interphasic space with only a duplicate Kirk aboard. Over the next two hundred years, it gains a sentient AI who attempts to bring it back into the prime universe. The attempt has potentially disastrous consequences and is foiled by both Kirks, the duplicate returning to interphasic space. A Defiant is mentioned, but not seen (except for a wireframe graphic) in Star Trek Discovery, Season One.Oddly, though the Defiant appears in TOS, the Star Fleet Technical Manual lists no Defiant in any of the starship classes mentioned though the book was published seven years after the fact. However, there are several classes not listed in the publication. The Defiant is listed as a Bonhomme Richard subclass of the Constitution class. In the Star Fleet Technical Manual, it lists the registry number of "NCC-1764" as belonging to the Galina. Since the Defiant appears in an episode, and the Galina does not, then the Defiant is the sole owner of the NCC-1764. But, one possibility is, the number was attached to the Galina after the disappearance of the Defiant.

name: USS Vengeance
description: Developed by Starfleet Admiral Alexander Marcus of Section 31 to combat the Klingon Empire.

name: USS Pilgrim
description: Active in the year 2159 in the vicinity of one of Starfleet's first starbases. Appears in the Star Trek videogame "Legacy".

name: USS Mesquite
description: Training ship, assigned to Starbase 1. Mentioned in Star Trek: Tactical Assault.

name: USS Paris
description: Destroyed in The Battle of Caleb IV.

name: USS Lantree
description: Crew died after exposure to genetically engineered humans. Destroyed by the USS Enterprise-D.

name: USS Tempest (simulation ship)
description: Simulated Miranda class vessel used by Academy trainees in Star Trek: Starfleet Academy.

name: USS Reliant
description: Ship on which Pavel Chekov serves as first officer. Assigned to Project Genesis and later hijacked by Khan Noonien Singh. Heavily damaged by USS Enterprise (NCC-1701), then destroyed by Genesis Device detonation.

name: USS Saratoga
description: Disabled by the Whale Probe.

name: USS Archon
description: Destroyed by an alien computer in 2167 near Beta III.

name: USS Sagittarius
description: Commanded by Clark Terrell prior to taking command of the USS Reliant. Assigned to explore the Taurus Reach. Presumably named for the constellation.

name: USS Yosemite
description: Studied the plasma arc between binary stars.

name: USS Sitak
description: Destroyed at the Battle for Deep Space 9.

name: USS Tripoli
description: Discovered by Data. Later assigned to Qualor II.

name: USS Soyuz
description: Presumable namesake ship for the class.

name: USS Bozeman
description: Spends several decades caught in a temporal causality loop; Commanded by Captain Morgan Bateson (Kelsey Grammer). Named for Bozeman, Montana, launching place of humanity's first warp ship and hometown of Brannon Braga, the writer of the episode the ship appeared in. The registration number was a reference to the 1979 film 1941 due to modelmaker Greg Jein working on both projects.

name: USS Bozeman
description: Successor to the first Bozeman. Participated in the Battle of Sector 001.

name: USS Trial
description: Part of a Starfleet task force at Deep Space Nine during the Klingon invasion of the Cardassian Union. Participates in the Battle for Deep Space 9.

name: USS Constellation
description: Participated in the Dominion War.

name: USS Explorer
description: Seen investigating the results of the Tabula Rasa Incident in the opening sequence of the video game Star Trek: New Worlds. Commanded by Captain Gibson.

name: USS Excelsior
description: Pathfinder and transwarp drive testbed. In The Search for Spock, the ship was dubbed "the great experiment" and was days away from its first test run. It was unexpectedly called into service to stop Admiral Kirk and his crew from stealing the soon to be decommissioned Enterprise. Attempting to use the transwarp drive to bring the ship back to spacedock, the Excelsior was sabotaged by Montgomery Scott and was left inoperable. Following the embarrassing failure, the Excelsior underwent repairs in spacedock before its recommission into active duty. Fails in attempt to rescue Captain James T. Kirk and Dr. Leonard McCoy from Qo'noS. Helps defeat General Chang over Khitomer. Ship aboard which Tuvok serves as science officer. Commanded by Captain Styles in Star Trek III: The Search for Spock and Captain Hikaru Sulu in Star Trek VI: The Undiscovered Country.

name: USS Valiant
description: Helps recover Enterprise-D crew at Veridian III.

name: USS Sydney
description: Presumable namesake ship for the class.

name: USS Paris (Simulation ship)
description: Simulated Excelsior class vessel used by Academy trainees in Star Trek: Starfleet Academy.

name: USS Jenolan
description: Crashed on the surface of a Dyson sphere while transporting Captain Montgomery Scott to a retirement colony. Montgomery Scott stored himself in the transporters of this starship. Destroyed.

name: USS Nash
description: Transports personnel to and from Deep Space Nine.

name: USS London
description: Participates in the Battle for Deep Space 9.

name: USS Dallas
description: Dedication plaque states "Last starship of her class".

name: USS Samuel B. Roberts
description: Part of the Starfleet task force during the final battle of the Dominion war. It was brought out of mothball status just two months before the final battle after having been extensively updated. It was badly damaged in the battle but survived. It was later decommissioned again and then scrapped after being deemed too far damaged to repair and mothball again.

name: USS Farragut
description: Transported several genetically enhanced humans to Deep Space Nine.

name: USS Brittain
description: Crew went insane due to loss of REM sleep.

name: USS Tiananmen
description: Part of the tachyon blockade during the Klingon Civil War. Went MIA while patrolling the Cardassian border during the Dominion War. Participates at the First Battle of Chin'toka. Named for the Tiananmen Square protests of 1989.

name: USS Repulse
description: Katherine Pulaski's assignment before the USS Enterprise-D. Served in the Dominion War.

name: USS Roosevelt
description: Destroyed at the Battle of Wolf 359.

name: USS Hathaway
description: Decommissioned, participated in exercises against the USS Enterprise-D. Its destruction was faked in a ruse to foil Ferengi attackers. Named for the wife of William Shakespeare.

name: USS Zhukov
description: Made cultural observation of Alpha Laputa IV. Previous assignment of Lt. Barclay before his transfer to the Enterprise-D Supporting ship in Star Trek: Bridge Commander, commanded by an Andorian Captain Verata, the ship escorts the USS Sovereign to Starbase 12 and participates in several battles.

name: USS Valdemar
description: Sent to the border of the Cardassian Demilitarized Zone.

name: USS Yamaguchi
description: Destroyed by the Borg at the Battle of Wolf 359.

name: USS Excalibur
description: Part of the tachyon blockade during the Klingon Civil War. Later commanded by Captain Mackenzie Calhoun in Star Trek: New Frontier.

name: USS Excalibur
description: Commanded by Captain Mackenzie Calhoun, primary setting for the latter part of Star Trek: New Frontier as successor to the Ambassador class ship of the same name.

name: USS Exeter
description: Tom Paris's assignment before being dismissed from Starfleet. Participated in the Dominion War. Later commanded by Captain Elizabeth Shelby, followed by Captain Alexandra Garbeck in Star Trek: New Frontier.

name: USS Gandhi
description: Ship to which Thomas Riker is assigned.

name: USS Loma Prieta
description: Flagship of Admiral T’Nae during Sela's assault on Vulcan in 2409.

name: USS Adelphi
description: Crew made first contact with the Ghorusda.

name: USS Wellington
description: Ship aboard which Ro Laren served, and where she was posted before being court-martialed. Underwent a computer system upgrade by Bynar technicians at Starbase 74.

name: USS Stargazer
description: Jean-Luc Picard's first command. Abandoned following the Battle of Maxia, later recovered by Starfleet.

name: USS Raman
description: Lost while investigating Marijne VII.

name: USS Magellan
description: Referred to by Captain Sisko as one of the ships to protect the USS Defiant's flank.

name: USS Majestic
description: Destroyed at the Battle for Deep Space 9.

name: USS Trident
description: Commanded by Captain Elizabeth Shelby and later by Captain Kat Mueller in Star Trek: New Frontier.

name: USS Bonestell
description: Destroyed in the Battle of Wolf 359.

name: USS ShirKahr
description: Destroyed in the First Battle of Chin'toka.

name: USS Nautilus
description: Participates in the First Battle of Chin'toka.

name: USS Saratoga
description: Ship aboard which Benjamin Sisko served as first officer. Destroyed at the Battle of Wolf 359.

name: USS Saratoga
description: Replaced previous Saratoga; little else known.

name: USS Zapata
description: Scheduled to rendezvous with the Enterprise-D. Fought in the Dominion War.

name: USS Havana
description: Scheduled to rendezvous with the Enterprise-D in 2369.

name: USS Constantinople
description: Suffered a hull breach transporting colonists to Gravesworld.

name: USS Merced
description: Presumable namesake ship for the class.

name: USS Trieste
description: Fell through a wormhole during Data's tour of duty. Stationed near Starbase 74 when the Enterprise-D is hijacked by the Bynars.

name: USS Sarajevo
description: Lost in the Gamma Quadrant in 2371. Later recovered and served in the Dominion War.

name: USS Gettysburg
description: Under Captain Mark Jameson, rescued hostages from Mordan IV. Served in the Dominion War.

name: USS Intrepid
description: Captained by Drew Dieghan. Responded to a Klingon distress call from the Khitomer outpost following a Romulan attack.

name: USS Crockett
description: Transported Admiral Mitsuya to Deep Space Nine.

name: USS Malinche
description: Commanded by Captain George Sanders. Patrolled the Cardassian border before the Dominion War. Severely damaged by the Maquis led by Michael Eddington. Destroyed in 2381 during the Borg Invasion.

name: USS Billings
description: Kathryn Janeway's first command.

name: USS Gorkon
description: Sent to face a possible Borg invasion.

name: USS Renaissance
description: Presumable namesake ship for the class.

name: USS Centaur
description: Centaur class: kitbash of the Excelsior and Miranda models.

name: USS Fredrickson
description: Briefly at Utopia Planitia Fleet Yards. Serves in the Dominion War.

name: USS Cairo
description: Transfers Captain Edward Jellico to the Enterprise-D.

name: USS Curry
description: Pathfinder ship for the Curry class, another "kitbash" model.

name: USS Charleston
description: Transported three previously cryogenically frozen people to Earth. Part of the tachyon blockade during the Klingon Civil War.

name: USS Hood
description: William Riker's assignment before his transfer to the USS Enterprise-D. Part of the tachyon blockade during the Klingon Civil War. Participates in the Battle for Deep Space 9 and First Battle of Chin'toka. Part of Battle Group Omega sent to intercept Reman warship Scimitar.

name: USS Righteous
description: Believed to have been vaporized by the Borg in 2366, in reality the ship was brought ten years into the future by Q in order to save it from destruction during the Battle of Wolf 359. Under the command of Captain Nikolai Andropov in Star Trek: Borg.

name: USS Lakota
description: Commanded by Captain Erika Benteen. Attempts to stop USS Defiant from reaching Earth under the orders of the rogue Admiral James Leyton.

name: USS Grissom
description: Assists the Enterprise-D during a contamination problem on Beta Agni II. Name pays tribute to astronaut Gus Grissom, commander of Apollo 1. Destroyed at the Battle of Ricktor Prime.

name: USS Al-Batani
description: Although it never appeared on screen, the Al-Batani is mentioned in dialogue as the first ship aboard which Kathryn Janeway served, which at the time was captained by Tom Paris' father Owen Paris. Never defined on screen, the class and registry number come from the non-canon Star Trek Encyclopedia.

name: USS Valley Forge
description: Damaged by an orbital defense platform at the Battle of Chin'toka.

name: USS Wyoming
description: Ship on which Tuvok served.

name: USS Lalo
description: Reports a "hiccup" in time that resulted from Dr. Paul Manheim's experiments. Destroyed by the Borg.

name: USS Archer
description: Presumable namesake ship for the class. Presumably named for Jonathan Archer.

name: USS Maryland
description: Missing in the Gamma Quadrant.

name: USS Aries
description: Ship offered to William Riker to command. Part of the tachyon blockade during the Klingon Civil War.

name: USS Hornet
description: Part of the tachyon blockade during the Klingon Civil War. Named for the World War II aircraft carrier. Participates in the Dominion War.

name: USS Lovell
description: Dedicated vessel of the Starfleet Corps of Engineers. Appears in the novel series Star Trek: Vanguard.Likely named after Capt. James Lovell, USN, Gemini and Apollo astronaut.

name: USS Antares aka SS Antares
description: Rescued and is later destroyed by Charlie Evans.

name: USS Biko
description: Rendezvoused with the USS Enterprise-D at Deinonychus VII.

name: USS Crazy Horse
description: Part of Task Force 3 sent to face an anticipated Borg invasion. Set to rendezvous with the Enterprise-D to transfer Rear Admiral Erik Pressman.

name: USS Appalachia
description: Participates in the Battle of Sector 001.

name: SS Santa Maria
description: Personnel Transport about 4 times the size of the Runabout. Cannibalised for parts and for use as a shelter by human settlers in a colony that rejects technology.

name: USS Springfield
description: Presumable namesake ship for the class.

name: USS Pegasus
description: Equipped with an illegal prototype cloaking device that malfunctions, causing the ship to become embedded inside an asteroid.

name: SS Tsiolkovsky
description: Crew infected by the Psi 2000 virus. Destroyed in asteroid collision.

name: USS Olympic
description: Presumable namesake ship for the class. The namesake for this vessel is most likely the ocean liner RMS Olympic.

name: USS Nobel
description: Visited Deep Space Three to search for the missing USS Hera. Served in the Dominion War.

name: USS Rutledge
description: Ship aboard which Miles O'Brien and Benjamin Maxwell served during the Cardassian War. Participated in the counterattack against the Klingons in the Archanis sector.

name: USS Chekov
description: Destroyed in the Battle of Wolf 359.

name: USS Portland
description: Searches the Algira sector for Odo and Elim Garak when their runabout goes missing.

name: USS Armstrong
description: Ambushed by a Klingon battle group. Name honors astronaut Neil Armstrong, commander of Apollo 11.

name: USS Kearsarge
description: Rendezvoused with the Enterprise-D.

name: USS Buran
description: Destroyed at the Battle of Wolf 359 commanded by Captain Lorca.

name: USS Pasteur
description: Ship commanded by Beverly Picard in an alternate timeline. Destroyed by warp core breach in the Devron system. Featured in the episode "All Good Things...".

name: USS Cochrane
description: Ferries Admiral Norah Satie to the Enterprise-D. and Julian Bashir and Lieutenant Jadzia Dax to Deep Space Nine.

name: USS Goddard
description: Delayed rendezvous with the Enterprise-D after the Acamarian Truce's signing. Part of the tachyon blockade during the Klingon Civil War.

name: USS Princeton
description: Destroyed at the Battle of Wolf 359.

name: USS Oberth
description: First ship of the class. Assigned to deep space exploration in 2293, when "Operation Retrieve" was proposed.

name: USS Honshū
description: Destroyed while transporting Gul Dukat to stand trial.

name: USS Farragut
description: Helps recover Enterprise-D crew at Veridian III. Destroyed in the Lembatta Cluster by Klingons.

name: USS Nightingale
description: Minor starship in Star Trek: Bridge Commander. Used as a search-and-rescue vessel. Fate uncertain.

name: USS LaGrange
description: Transports negotiators in the game Star Trek: Starfleet Academy. This ship is destroyed by the simulator.

name: USS Monitor
description: Sent to the Romulan Neutral Zone in anticipation of a possible Romulan attack.

name: USS Merrimack
description: Transported Sarek from Legara IV to Vulcan.

name: USS Lexington
description: Participates in the Battle of Sector 001.

name: USS Yeager
description: Participates in the Battle of Sector 001.

name: USS Proxima
description: Missing in the Gamma Quadrant.

name: USS Rigel
description: Presumable namesake ship for the class.

name: USS Hera
description: Disappeared while under the command of Captain Silva La Forge with a mostly Vulcan crew of 300.

name: USS LaSalle
description: Reports unusual radiation anomalies in the Gamma Arigulon system.

name: USS Melbourne
description: Destroyed at the Battle of Wolf 359. Remains of ship visible in aftermath of the battle in Star Trek: The Next Generation episode "The Best of Both Worlds, Part 2". Registry and name same as Excelsior class ship seen in Star Trek: Deep Space Nine pilot episode "Emissary".

name: USS Melbourne
description: Offered to William Riker to command. Starfleet flagship at the Battle of Wolf 359, where it is destroyed.

name: USS Bellerephon
description: Destroyed at the Battle of Wolf 359.

name: USS Tolstoy
description: Destroyed in the Battle of Wolf 359.

name: USS T'Kumbra
description: All-Vulcan crew challenges the Deep Space Nine crew to a game of baseball. Participated in the Dominion War.

name: USS Akagi
description: Part of the tachyon blockade during the Klingon Civil War. Served in the Dominion War. Named for HIJMS Akagi.

name: USS Arcos
description: Destroyed by a warp core breach near Turkana IV in 2367. Crew evacuates to the planet's surface and is rescued by the Enterprise-D.

name: USS Renegade
description: Rendezvoused with the Enterprise-D over Dytallix B, where Captain Tryla Scott met with Jean-Luc Picard to discuss an alien conspiracy to take over Starfleet.

name: USS Rabin
description: Participates in the Battle of Sector 001.

name: USS Summit
description: Attempts to rescue the Enterprise-E on Gemworld. Destroyed by a dimensional rift immediately after dropping out of warp. Lost with all hands.

name: USS Thunderchild
description: Participates in the Battle of Sector 001 in 2373.

name: USS Grissom
description: Transports David Marcus and Lieutenant Saavik to the Genesis planet. Destroyed by Klingons. Named for NASA astronaut Virgil I. "Gus" Grissom who died during preparations and testing for the Apollo One mission. Commanded by Captain J. T. Esteban.

name: USS Dakota
description: Participates in the Battle of Sector 001 in 2373. Lost patrolling the border of the Cardassian Demilitarized Zone.

name: USS Banting (simulation ship)
description: Simulated Oberth class vessel used by Academy trainees in Star Trek: Starfleet Academy.

name: USS Copernicus
description: Berthed at spacedock.

name: USS Delestrez
description: Commanded by Captain Juliette; Supporting ship in Celestia Universe.

name: USS Devore
description: Commanded by Captain Joshua Martin; Supporting ship in Star Trek: Bridge Commander.

name: USS Berkeley
description: Minor starship in Star Trek: Bridge Commander. Originally sent to study the Vesuvi Dust Cloud but failed due to the intense radiation of the dust cloud. Attacked by a Kessok probe but survived. Fate uncertain.

name: USS Budapest
description: Participates in the Battle of Sector 001.

name: USS Phoenix
description: Carries out unauthorized attacks on Cardassian ships while under the command of Captain Benjamin Maxwell. Not specified whether she is named for the mythological bird, the American city, or humanity's first FTL-capable spacecraft.

name: USS Kyushu
description: Destroyed at the Battle of Wolf 359.

name: USS Thomas Paine
description: Rendezvoused with the Enterprise-D over Dytallix B, where Captain Rixx met with Jean-Luc Picard to discuss an alien conspiracy to take over Starfleet. Part of the tachyon blockade during the Klingon Civil War.

name: USS Gryphon
description: Commanded by Captain Elaine Mello. Assigned to defend Deep Space Nine for a short period of time after the Dominion War in the Deep Space Nine relaunch.

name: USS Surak
description: Presumable namesake ship for the class.

name: USS Khitomer
description: Minor starship in Star Trek: Bridge Commander. Lead a failed assault on Alioth 6. Fate uncertain.

name: USS Ulysses
description: Studied protoplanetary masses in the Helaspont Nebula.

name: USS Concorde
description: Assigned near the Romulan Neutral Zone in an alternate timeline.

name: USS Firebrand
description: Destroyed at the Battle of Wolf 359.

name: USS Prokofiev
description: Dispatched to the border of the Federation–Cardassian Demilitarized Zone.

name: USS Geronimo
description: Commanded by Captain Gregory McCray; Major supporting ship in Star Trek: Bridge Commander.

name: USS San Francisco
description: Minor supporting vessel in Star Trek: Bridge Commander. Fate uncertain.

name: USS Sequoia
description: Presumable namesake ship for the class.

name: USS Yellowstone
description: Transports Ensign Melora Pazlar to Deep Space Nine in 2370.

name: USS Endurance
description: Mentioned as replacement ship for Captain Christine McDonald in the book Star Trek: Preserver.

name: USS Leeds
description: Participates in the Battle for Deep Space 9.

name: USS Galaxy
description: Pathfinder. Participates in the Battle for Deep Space 9, First Battle of Chin'toka, and Battle of Cardassia. Part of Battle Group Omega sent to intercept Reman warship Scimitar.

name: USS Bonchune
description: Sent to recover the USS Prometheus.

name: USS Drake
description: Ambushed by a Klingon battle squadron.

name: USS Challenger
description: Witnesses the return of USS Voyager to Earth. Commanded by Captain Geordi La Forge in an alternate future.

name: USS Prometheus
description: Used by Dr. Gideon Seyetik in his project to reignite a dead star.

name: USS Leyte Gulf
description: Commanded by Captain Aaron Juraj; first Starfleet vessel to be infected by nanites in Star Trek: Away Team.

name: USS Ahwahnee
description: Heavily damaged at the Battle of Wolf 359. Presumed repaired to participate in the tachyon blockade during the Klingon Civil War.

name: USS Endeavour
description: Part of the tachyon blockade during the Klingon Civil War. Participates at the Battle of Sector 001.

name: USS Yamato
description: Crew discovered Iconian artifacts but is infected by a computer virus that causes antimatter containment loss. The virus causes the ship to explode with all hands lost. Commanded by Captain Donald Varley.

name: USS Musashi
description: Mentioned in the conversation of log transcription for Graviton Stabilizer by Ensign Nog.

name: USS Odyssey
description: Sent to rescue Benjamin Sisko from the Jem'Hadar. Destroyed in the rescue attempt.

name: USS Robinson
description: Taken command of by Benjamin Sisko after the Borg Invasion of 2381 in the novel Star Trek: Typhon Pact – Rough Beasts of Empire.

name: USS Venture
description: Part of a Starfleet task force at Deep Space Nine during the Klingon invasion of the Cardassian Union. Participates in the Battle for Deep Space 9 and the First Battle of Chin'toka.

name: USS Trinculo
description: Part of the Starfleet Armada tasked with retaking Deep Space 9 from Dominion control during "Operation Return" (DS:9 episode "Sacrifice of Angels")

name: USS Dauntless
description: First ship under players' command in Star Trek: Bridge Commander. Destroyed while escorting a transport by Cardassian ships.

name: USS Sutherland
description: Briefly commanded by Lieutenant Commander Data while part of the tachyon blockade during the Klingon Civil War.

name: USS Sarek
description: Replaced USS Cortez in formation during operation to retake DS9.

name: USS Equinox
description: Stranded in the Delta Quadrant. Heavily damaged by USS Voyager and destroyed by self-destruct initiated by Captain Rudolph Ransom.

name: USS Everett
description: Commanded by Captain Claudia Alisov. Attached to the Department of Temporal Investigations. Appears in the Department of Temporal Investigations novels.

name: USS Rio Grande
description: Vessel aboard which Jadzia Dax and Benjamin Sisko discover the Bajoran wormhole. Later located the missing Sword of Kahless. Helps rescue Sisko from the Jem'Hadar. Longest surviving DS9 runabout.[original research?]

name: USS Yangtzee Kiang
description: Hijacked by Bajoran terrorist Tahna Los. Became the first DS9 runabout to be destroyed when it crashed on a moon in the Gamma Quadrant.

name: USS Ganges
description: Captured Tahna Los. Rescued Vash from the Gamma Quadrant. Destroyed by a T'Lani Munitions Cruiser.

name: USS Mekong
description: Helps rescue Benjamin Sisko from the Jem'Hadar. Destroyed by the Jem'Hadar during the Obsidian Order/Tal Shiar attack on the Founders' homeworld in the Omarian Nebula.

name: USS Rhode Island
description: Commanded by Captain Harry Kim in an alternate future.

name: USS Orinoco
description: Helps rescue Benjamin Sisko from the Jem'Hadar. Destroyed by the Cardassian terrorist group "The True Way".

name: USS Rubicon
description: Shrunk to 6.5 centimeters.

name: USS Shenandoah
description: Taken by Dax and Worf to rescue a Cardassian informant from the Dominion. Severely damaged by the Jem'Hadar en route to deliver diplomatic message to Grand Nagus Zek.

name: USS Volga
description: Participates in botanical survey of Torad IV.

name: USS Gander
description: Taken by Ezri Dax to search for Worf. Destroyed by the Jem'Hadar.

name: USS Lionheart
description: Medical vessel temporarily commanded by Christine Vale in the novel Star Trek: The Fall - The Poisoned Chalice.

name: USS Valiant
description: Starfleet Academy Red Squad training ship. The vessel gets caught behind enemy lines after the outbreak of the Dominion War, suffered heavy losses among the standard crew and was subsequently commanded by the cadets of Red Squad. Destroyed by the Jem'Hadar after a failed attempt to destroy a new Dominion vessel. Only three people survived the destruction of the ship, (Jake Sisko, Nog, and Collins, a member of Red Squad).

name: USS Saladin
description: Commanded by Captain Shinoda during the Dominion War in the short story "Safe Harbors".

name: USS Twilight
description: Starfleet Intelligence attached science vessel temporarily commanded by Jaryd Harker, MD in the novel Star Trek: Adamant.

name: USS Pathfinder
description: Captain Christine McDonald's new command in the book Star Trek: Preserver. Destroyed in battle with USS Enterprise (NCC-1701-E) and Ferengi Marauder-class starship Leveraged Buyout around planet Halkan.

name: USS Intrepid
description: Pathfinder vessel. Part of Battle Group Omega sent to intercept Reman warship Scimitar.

name: USS Yukon
description: Stolen by Founder in failed attempt to destroy the Bajoran sun. Destroyed by a Protomatter Device also killing a Founder.

name: USS Voyager
description: Primary setting of Star Trek: Voyager where it is commanded by Captain Kathryn Janeway. Commanded by Captain Chakotay in the "Enemy of My Enemy" book series, then commanded by Captain Afsarah Eden in the novel Unworthy, then by Captain Chakotay as final commander in the novels Full Circle and Children of the Storm.

name: USS Bellerophon
description: Transports Federation personnel to a summit on Romulus. Flagship of Vice Admiral Ross during parts of the Dominion War.

name: USS Sally Ride
description: Designed for deep space exploration and scientific discovery. It is the third ship in the Intrepid-class, having been commissioned at the same time as the USS Voyager. It has a cruising speed of warp 6 and a maximum sustainable speed of warp 9.975. Its armaments include ablative armor and quantum torpedoes. Commanded by Capt. Rafael Martinez. It appears in the Geek & Sundry web show Shield of Tomorrow.

name: USS Destiny
description: Ezri Tigan's prior assignment before transferring to Deep Space Nine.

name: USS Monitor
description: Mentioned in both the books The Return and Preserver, lost under command of Captain John Scott Lewinski attempting to set a new warp speed record with recovered Borg transwarp drive.

name: USS Yolja
description: First runabout to be named after a non-Earth river. Assigned to Deep Space 9. Appeared in Worlds of Star Trek: Deep Space Nine, Volume Three – The Dominion: Olympus Descending.

name: USS Valiant
description: The Defiant class starship, USS Valiant NCC-74210 was destroyed in the year 2374 by the Jem'Hadar after a failed attempt to destroy a new Dominion Battleship class vessel. The new Valiant was put into active service just one year later as a Sovereign class starship.

name: USS Gibraltar
description: Sacrificed itself against the Borg in 2381 in Star Trek: Destiny.

name: USS Achilles
description: Commanded by Captain Tillum Drafar. Part of "Project Full Circle" in the Star Trek: Voyager novel Full Circle.

name: USS Cortez
description: Referred to by Chief O'Brien and Captain Sisko during the mission to retake DS9. Lost patrolling Cardassian border

name: USS Lynx
description: The Lynx was a troop transport during the Third Klingon And Federation War. She was later destroyed in a skirmish with a couple of Klingon Birds Of Prey, with all hands lost.

name: USS Saber
description: Presumable namesake ship for the class.

name: USS Titan
description: The USS Titan is the first command of Captain William Thomas Riker, former first officer of the USS Enterprise-D and USS Enterprise-E.A Luna-class starship, designed primarily for scientific discovery. Described as 450 meters long, the Titan was built with state-of-the-art science facilities as opposed to being a more tactically pronounced starship. With a complement of about 350 persons, the USS Titan comprises the most racially diverse crew in Starfleet, with less than 15% of the population being human, as well as a number of non-humanoid beings.A full set of schematics of the USS Titan is available in the novel Sword of Damocles of the Star Trek: Titan novel series.

name: USS Callisto
description: Captained by Admiral Trenton Cole, a long time friend of Picard's.

name: USS Rhea
description: Captained by Captain Bazel, a Saurian.

name: USS Charon
description: Captained by Bellatora Fortis and destroyed during the novel Sword of Damocles of the Star Trek: Titan novel series.

name: USS Krakatoa
description: Captained by Bartholomew Stavisky, a long time friend of Benjamin Sisko. Last command was USS Illinois NCC-12512, States class.

name: USS da Vinci
description: Lead ship in Starfleet Corps of Engineers novel series. Named for Leonardo da Vinci.

name: USS Curie
description: Commanded by Captain Xin Chan. Part of "Project Full Circle" in the Star Trek: Voyager novel Full Circle.

name: USS Planck
description: Commanded by Captain Hosc T'Mar. Part of "Project Full Circle" in the Star Trek: Voyager novel Full Circle.

name: USS Hawking
description: Commanded by Captain Bal Itak. Part of "Project Full Circle" in the Star Trek: Voyager novel Full Circle.

name: USS Vesta
description: Commanded by Captain Regina Farkas. Lead ship of the Vesta class. Mothballed soon after launch due to technical issues. Relaunched and becomes part of "Project Full Circle" in 2381 in the Star Trek: Voyager novel Protectors.

name: USS Aventine
description: First command of Captain Ezri Dax in Star Trek: Destiny. Has prototype slipstream warp drive.

name: USS Quirinal
description: Commanded by Captain Regina Farkas. Part of "Project Full Circle" in the Star Trek: Voyager novel Full Circle. Destroyed by the Omega Continuum in 2381 in The Eternal Tide.

name: USS Esquiline
description: Commanded by Captain Parimon Dasht. Part of "Project Full Circle" in the Star Trek: Voyager novel Full Circle. Destroyed by the Omega Continuum in 2381 in The Eternal Tide.

name: USS Capitoline
description: Attached to the Department of Temporal Investigations. Mentioned in the Department of Temporal Investigations novels.

name: USS Atlas
description: Commanded by Morgan Bateson in the 2380s.

name: USS James T Kirk
description: Commanded by Captain Elias Vaughn. Named in honor of the famous Starfleet captain. Destroyed in the defense of Federation worlds against the mass Borg Invasion of 2381, resulting in the death of 31 crew members and Captain Vaughn being left brain dead.

name: USS Yorktown
description: The Yorktown fought at the Battle of Sol in the Iconian war, and was nearly destroyed. It was later found by Starfleet and refitted into the Yorktown subclass of the Odyssey class starships.

name: USS Hamilton
description: The Hamilton fought in many skirmishes along the Klingon border during the Third Klingon And Federation War. She later fought in the second battle of DS9 alongside ships like the USS Enterprise. The Hamilton was a major component during the Iconian War. She was later destroyed in a Hur’q attack at DS9.

name: USS Kent
description: The Kent was a ship of exploration in the early 25th Century. She later went missing during the Iconian War. Two years after she went missing, a fragment of her hull was found adrift in the Ba'aja Sector. The rest of the ship was later found in the Boreth Sector in 2429.

name: USS Victory
description: Ship on which Geordi La Forge once served. Participated in the Dominion War. Named after the Napoleonic Wars British Royal Navy flagship, HMS Victory flagship of Horatio Nelson, 1st Viscount Nelson.

name: USS Victory
description: The Victory was the Last Odyssey class starship to be built. She was launched in late 2419 and would be used as an exploration vessel. She was named after the battleship HMS Victory.

name: USS Pastak
description: Timeship that saves the character from a Tholian attack in Star Trek Online.

name: USS Relativity
description: Timeship Relativity, from the 29th century, ship designed to transport people through time, set on a mission to prevent the destruction of the USS Voyager.

name: USS Wells
description: Presumable namesake ship for the class.

name: Enterprise
description: Lead ship. Captained by Jonathan Archer. Primary setting for Star Trek: Enterprise. Launched in 2151. Decommissioned in 2161.

name: Columbia
description: Commanded by Captain Erika Hernandez. Launched in 2154 and participated in the Klingon–Augment crisis. After an uncertain term of service, it was eventually lost but was later discovered intact on a desert planet in the Gamma Quadrant. Fate of crew unknown.

name: Challenger
description: Mentioned in the Star Trek: Enterprise novel The Romulan War: Beneath the Raptor's Wing.

name: Discovery
description: Mentioned in the Star Trek: Enterprise novel The Romulan War: Beneath the Raptor's Wing.

name: Atlantis
description: Mentioned in the Star Trek: Enterprise novel The Romulan War: Beneath the Raptor's Wing.

name: Endeavour
description: Mentioned in the Star Trek: Enterprise novels The Romulan War: Beneath the Raptor's Wing and The Romulan War: To Brave the Storm. Later entered Federation Starfleet service and rebuilt into Columbia class.

name: Intrepid
description: Commanded by Jason Lambert. Mentioned in the Star Trek: The Next Generation novel Indistinguishable from Magic.

name: ISS Avenger
description: In the Mirror Universe, an Imperial Starfleet warship.

name: USS Ranger
description: Lost during the Borg Invasion of 2381, the vessel was defending the planet Khitomer.

name: USS Huang Zhong
description: Mentioned in the tie-in novel Star Trek: Seekers #4: All That's Left. Crashed on a planet in a spatial rift. Crew rescued by the Enterprise resulting in first contact with the Dolysians.

name: USS Prometheus
description: First class starship; still under development; captured by Romulans and recovered by Starfleet personnel after the EMH from USS Voyager and the EMH Mark II incapacitated the Romulan crew.

name: USS Nebula
description: Presumable namesake ship for the class.

name: USS Norway
description: Presumable namesake ship for the class.

name: USS Danube
description: First ship of the class. Mentioned in Star Trek: Deep Space Nine Technical Manual.

name: USS Nova
description: Presumable namesake ship for the class.

name: USS Sovereign
description: First ship of the class which acts as a pathfinder ship. Appears in Star Trek Bridge Commander. Also features in the Shatnerverse novel Spectre.

name: USS Liberty
description: Part of Battle Group Omega sent to intercept Reman warship Scimitar. Commanded by Captain Carl S. Bouchillon.

name: USS Defiant
description: Pathfinder. Assigned to space station Deep Space Nine. Participates in the Battle of Sector 001. Destroyed at the Second Battle of Chin'toka.

name: USS Yellowstone
description: Prototype for an advanced runabout designed in large part by Ensign Harry Kim and Lieutenant Laska in an alternate timeline. Destroyed by antimatter containment loss.

name: USS Steamrunner
description: Presumable namesake ship for the class.

name: USS Luna
description: The prototype for the Luna-class. The ship was destroyed by a catastrophic engine failure before the events described in the novel Taking Wing of the Star Trek: Titan novel series took place.

name: USS Galen
description: Prototype, commanded by Commander Clarissa Glenn. Part of the Project Full Circle in the Star Trek: Voyager relaunch novels.

name: USS Odyssey
description: First ship of the Odyssey-class. Commissioned at Utopia Planetia. Currently in service.
